verses.kjv: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD! Give thanks to the LORD because he is good — his mercy lasts forever.

verses.kjv: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?
verses.ct: Who could possibly describe all the mighty things the LORD has done? Who could fully express all the praise he deserves?

verses.kjv: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
verses.ct: How happy are those who act with justice and who practice righteousness at all times.

verses.kjv: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;
verses.ct: Remember me, LORD, with the same kindness you show your people. Come to me with your salvation,

verses.kjv: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
verses.ct: so that I can experience the prosperity of your chosen ones, share in the joy of your nation, and celebrate alongside those who belong to you.

verses.kjv: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
verses.ct: We have sinned just like our ancestors — we have done wrong and acted wickedly.

verses.kjv: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.
verses.ct: Our ancestors didn't grasp the meaning of your miracles in Egypt. They didn't keep in mind your many acts of mercy. Instead, they rebelled at the sea — at the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
verses.ct: Yet he rescued them for the sake of his name, to demonstrate his mighty power.

verses.kjv: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
verses.ct: He commanded the Red Sea, and it dried up. He guided them through the deep waters as easily as walking through a desert.

verses.kjv: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.ct: He rescued them from the grip of those who hated them and freed them from the power of their enemies.

verses.kjv: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
verses.ct: The waters rushed over their enemies — not a single one survived.

verses.kjv: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
verses.ct: Then they believed what he had promised, and they sang songs of praise to him.

verses.kjv: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:
verses.ct: But they quickly forgot what he had done and didn't wait for his guidance.

verses.kjv: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
verses.ct: They gave in to intense cravings in the wilderness and tested God in that desolate place.

verses.kjv: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
verses.ct: He gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease on their souls.

verses.kjv: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
verses.ct: They grew jealous of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron, the one set apart for the LORD.

verses.kjv: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
verses.ct: The ground split open and swallowed Dathan, closing over Abiram and his followers.

verses.kjv: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
verses.ct: Fire broke out among their group, and flames consumed the wicked.

verses.kjv: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
verses.ct: They crafted a calf at Horeb and bowed down to an idol made of metal.

verses.kjv: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
verses.ct: They traded their glorious God for the image of a grass-eating ox.

verses.kjv: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;
verses.ct: They forgot God, their rescuer, who had performed great things in Egypt —

verses.kjv: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.
verses.ct: amazing wonders in the land of Ham, and awe-inspiring acts at the Red Sea.

verses.kjv: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
verses.ct: So he declared he would destroy them. But Moses, his chosen one, stepped into the gap before him to turn back his anger and prevent their destruction.

verses.kjv: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:
verses.ct: Then they rejected the beautiful land and refused to trust his promise.

verses.kjv: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.
verses.ct: They grumbled inside their tents and would not listen to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:
verses.ct: So he raised his hand in an oath against them, vowing to bring them down in the wilderness,

verses.kjv: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
verses.ct: to scatter their descendants among the nations and disperse them across foreign lands.

verses.kjv: They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
verses.ct: They also devoted themselves to Baalpeor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods.

verses.kjv: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
verses.ct: They provoked him to anger with their actions, and a plague broke out among them.

verses.kjv: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.
verses.ct: Then Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was stopped.

verses.kjv: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.
verses.ct: This was credited to him as righteousness for every generation to come, forever.

verses.kjv: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
verses.ct: They also made him angry at the waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered because of them.

verses.kjv: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
verses.ct: Because they pushed his spirit to the breaking point, and he spoke rashly.

verses.kjv: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
verses.ct: They failed to wipe out the peoples that the LORD had commanded them to destroy.

verses.kjv: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.
verses.ct: Instead, they mixed in with the surrounding nations and adopted their practices.

verses.kjv: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.
verses.ct: They worshiped their idols, which became a trap for them.

verses.kjv: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,
verses.ct: They even sacrificed their own sons and daughters to demons.

verses.kjv: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.
verses.ct: They spilled innocent blood — the blood of their own sons and daughters — sacrificing them to the idols of Canaan. The land became contaminated with bloodshed.

verses.kjv: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
verses.ct: They made themselves unclean through their actions and were unfaithful to God through their practices.

verses.kjv: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
verses.ct: So the LORD's anger burned against his people, and he was disgusted with those who belonged to him.

verses.kjv: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.
verses.ct: He handed them over to foreign nations, and those who hated them became their rulers.

verses.kjv: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
verses.ct: Their enemies crushed them and kept them in subjection under their power.

verses.kjv: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.
verses.ct: Time after time he rescued them, but they kept rebelling through their own schemes and sank deeper because of their sin.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:
verses.ct: Even so, he paid attention to their suffering whenever he heard them cry out.

verses.kjv: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
verses.ct: He recalled his covenant with them and relented because of his abundant mercy.

verses.kjv: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
verses.ct: He also caused their captors to treat them with compassion.

verses.kjv: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
verses.ct: Rescue us, LORD our God! Gather us from among the nations so we can give thanks to your holy name and celebrate in praising you.

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity! Let all the people say, "Amen!" Praise the LORD!
